github.copilot.chat.commitMessageGenerat.text: Use Semantic Commit Messages format exactly: <type>: <subject>.
Allowed <type> values only: chore, docs, feat, fix, refactor, style, test.
Subject rules: present tense, start with a verb, keep it concise (<= 72 chars), no trailing period.

Tailor the subject to this monorepo: mention the area touched (landing, docs, playground, ui, lint, typecheck, agents) in the subject when helpful (e.g., 'docs: update turbo commands for docs app', 'feat: add button variants to ui').
If changes span multiple areas, prefer a higher-level subject (e.g., 'chore: align tooling configs across repo') instead of listing everything.
If a body is generated, keep it short: 1-3 bullet points describing what changed, no extra fluff.
